metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6886 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: The pstm_reverse function in MatrixSSL before 3.8.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid memory read and crash) via a (1) zero value or (2) the key's modulus for the secret key during RSA key exchange.

criterions.comment: matrixssl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
